column4: I used brasero to copy a CD to a .iso image, and when i mounted the iso all the files have a semi-colon appended to the name, and the folder names are truncated and any spaces replaced with underscores. What is going wrong?(I also tried using dd)
Okay... wierd... when i mount it with command line using the syntax: sudo mount filename.iso /media/iso -t iso9660 -o loop, it works. If i use GUI it doesn't...
